revised_title: Post-embryonic Development of Jumping Spider Retina: Acquisition and Reorganization of Rhabdomeres and Glial Matrix
tldr: This study examines the post-embryonic development of the principal retina in jumping spiders, focusing on the acquisition and reorganization of rhabdomeres and the growth of the glial matrix. The research describes the ultrastructural morphogenesis of individual receptive segments, including the growth of microvilli and the development of light-guiding properties in rhabdomeres of Layer I. The findings contribute to understanding the evolution and function of the complex photoreceptor mosaics in these spiders.
